user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of process_param__thread_per_conn:
```c
static enum PerfRepl_param_result
process_param__thread_per_conn (const char *param_name)
{
  if (tool_params.all_cpus)
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "Parameter '%s' cannot be used together "
             "with '-A' or '--all-cpus'.\n", param_name);
    return PERF_RPL_PARAM_ERROR;
  }
  if (0 != tool_params.threads)
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "Parameter '%s' cannot be used together "
             "with '-t' or '--threads'.\n", param_name);
    return PERF_RPL_PARAM_ERROR;
  }
  tool_params.thread_per_conn = ! 0;
  return '-' == param_name[1] ?
         PERF_RPL_PARAM_FULL_STR :PERF_RPL_PARAM_ONE_CHAR;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
  if (0 != tool_params.threads)
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "Parameter '%s' cannot be used together "
             "with '-t' or '--threads'.\n", param_name);
    return PERF_RPL_PARAM_ERROR;
  }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: This fragment is reachable at runtime when tool_params.threads != 0 — e.g. the user previously supplied '-t' (or '--threads') so tool_params.threads was set to a non‑zero value, then process_param__thread_per_conn() is called; the fprintf and return PERF_RPL_PARAM_ERROR will execute. There is no constant condition or dead code in the snippet itself.
